intro: Erigeron arthrotrichus, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small white or pale blue flowers. Erigeron arthrotrichus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
